newsitem.title: SYRIA: Syria accuses Israel of killing U.N. in Golan.
newsitem.headline: Syria accuses Israel of killing U.N. in Golan.

text.p: Syria accused the Israeli secret service Mossad on Saturday of killing two Austrian U.N. soldiers on the Golan Heights last month.

Officials quoted Defence Minister Lieutenant-General Mustafa Tlas as telling an Austrian military delegation that preliminary investigations showed Mossad was behind the killing of Warrant Officer Volfgang Grasser and Master Corporal Gerhard Karitschnig.

The two Austrians served with their country's contingent of 400-military observers in UNDOF, the United Nations force which has been stationed in the Golan Heights since Israel and Syria pulled troops back from the front line after the 1973 Middle East War.
They were on foot patrol about eight km (five miles) inside Syrian-controlled territory when they were killed around midday on May 30.
Israel denied it was involved and an Israeli security source told Reuters in Jerusalem that smugglers were active in the area.

Syrian officials said Tlas made his comments at a meeting in Damascus with a representative of the Austrian defence minister, the Austrian ambassador to Syria and the commander of Austria's UNDOF contingent.
